title: Tory MP kicked out of conference after security clash
text:
The Conservative Party Conference continued for the third day on October 1, 2019 in Manchester, England | Jeff J Mitchell/Getty Images Tory MP kicked out of conference after security clash Police confirmed the incident in Manchester.

MANCHESTER, England — A senior Conservative MP was booted out of the party’s annual conference in Manchester Tuesday afternoon after he clashed with staff in a security row.

Geoffrey Clifton-Brown, who serves as treasurer of the 1922 committee of Tory backbench MPs, “remonstrated” with a member of staff after he tried to bring somebody into a secure area for which they did not have the right pass.

Security personnel were forced to intervene after the exchange became heated and police attended the scene.

A Conservative Party spokesman said: “The incident was totally unacceptable. Geoffrey has been asked to leave conference and we are establishing all of the facts to see if further action is necessary.

“We will always adopt a zero-tolerance approach to any inappropriate behavior towards our hardworking staff.”

Greater Manchester Police confirmed the incident in a statement. “Security staff intervened and resolved the situation without any breach of security occurring,” the statement said.

Clifton-Brown could not be reached by the time of publication.
description: Police confirmed the incident in Manchester.
